intro: Castilleja densiflora var. densiflora, commonly known as the denseflower Indian paintbrush, is a hemiparasitic flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its bright red or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has a short, erect stem with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its roots form a symbiotic relationship with the roots of neighboring plants, drawing nutrients from them. This species is adapted to dry, open habitats such as grasslands and meadows.
